content: I see Google results indicating that error is to do with Google accounts on Android devices but you appear to have posted from a windows device. This is the desktop forum, so can you confirm the operating system and Thunderbird version please.

content:
probably by uninstalling your antivirus product of choice. They have scam and spam tools that tend to do this sort of thing periodically. I think it was kaspersky last time. Seriously. But you could try the following to work through the steps to determine the cause.

1. Run Thunderbird in Troubleshooting mode. if you problems continue try 2. 2. Run Thunderbird in Troubleshooting mode while the operating system is in safe mode with networking.

Does Thunderbird act out in either of those circumstances?

What email provider do you use? What email protocol do you use?
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hey Matt, First off -- mucho thanks for sharing your expertise with us -- making our Mozilla world(s) function better -- and potentially supporting the practical appeal of OSS (Public Infrastructure Software) for everyday folks. I now want to be very -- diplomatic and polite -- to ask that we all try to be more -- diplomatic and polite -- (less contentious) by respecting the "preferences" others have that likely differ from our own (likely with different "costs vs benefits).

My "preference" here for "importing" EML files to TB 115.10 -- is in the subject line of my second request for help to "import" EML files -- "using no extension" Maybe I have a reason for that preference (I do! perhaps to be discussed). I first disclose I'm aware of a popular Extension / "Add on" (is there a difference?) and name it in the message -- but am only asking -- How can I do this (that I once did) using only native tools in TB 115.10 (or maybe also Win 10 tools?)

If no one can counsel me on how to do that -- sure, you bet, I'll take another closer look ImportExportTools NG -- with it's permission (access to everything). Unless costs v bennies dictate -- for me – I avoid any "unnecessary permission” and it’s potential for any un-deliberated risk. Is there a community discussion parsing out “permissions”?

That's leads to "finding" discussions -- here on "importing EMLs" -- that you cite -- which I couldn't find -- try as I did (hard). Looked in ALL Mozilla / TB only / community forum / support database. Nada (for my question). Couldn’t even find my first request (still can’t) – so never even saw some of the answers you cite (that don’t answer my request -- some saying it doesn't work).

And that leads me to quote you on your kind response -- to my quest to find a "hard string" search in TB. "Thunderbird tokenizer will make that extremely difficult, if not impossible, on a global search." Tokenizer, suggests to me maybe some "AI" -- that might be perfect for this support “use case". Though I still seek a “hard string” – basic compare – here the global search seems perfect to find ALL (filtered) EML discussion.

So, in summary (finally) please don't mark my (using no extension) query as done solved -- and hopefully there is someone, somewhere who knows my non-extension answer. Thanks.

content:
Perhaps refer to the user support documentation. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password

I do not know of a way to set a primary password without following the instructions in the link. It is not something that happens accidentally, so I would counsel you to be very sure it is a primary password you are looking for. Frequently when antivirus products drop their bundle and fail like some past date politician Thunderbird asks for account passwords again because the AV is messing with the connection.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I bet we can fix this together!

Click on that little box that says "Quick filter" and look to see if you have a filter in place that might be impacting the results you see in that window.

If not, then try to right click on the affected folders and select Properties. Once there, click the box that says Repair folder and wait a moment (less than minute; progress bar on bottom of page) while the app does its thing.

Do this for each folder.

Good Luck and let us know if it gets fixed!
creator: Thundamike

content:
is the account configured as IMAP or POP? If POP is the account configured to delete messages from the serv er on download or to leave them there.

Do you use this account on another device like a phone? does it use IMAP or PP these are all relevant questions to try and determine what happens when mail is retreived.

I would point out that I ceased using my Bigpond accounts email many years ago as Telstra demonstrated a long term inability to actually administer an email server, or provide anything that looked like support for their service. Having someone that knows nothing answer the phone is not user support, except at Telstra.

content: It might be your phone is set for POP. shut the phone off, send yourself a message, read it in PC and then turn phone on and see if it reads message. Shut thunderbird on PC down and restart. Is the message still there on PC? If not, the phone is deleting it.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks for the advice.

The account settings on both phone and computer specify IMAP.

The download issue only occurs if the email is first read on the phone. Otherwise, unread messages are synchronized accurately by Thunderbird. Marking the email as unread (on the phone) does not immediately correct the issue.

Note that I also have Outlook installed on my computer. Outlook appears to have no issues with synchronizing across hardware. This seems to be a quirk in TB.

The reverse does not seem to be an issue. The phone is able to synchronize all emails whether I read them on the computer within TB first or not.
creator: mkostura

content:
You did not show your incoming settings. These usually work:

- incoming: outlook.office365.com, port 993, SSL/TLS, Oauth2 (assuming IMAP) - outgoing: smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2
creator: davidsk
